intro: Microchilus robustus, commonly known as the robust microchilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or orange. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in forest understories, where it forms dense clusters. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
